name: Bootiful129
review: I'm always looking for a good under eye concealer, and this formula is the best I've found so far.

name: fuzzy kitty
review: Was cakey and oily. Was difficult to get it to conceal acne because it would smear off when I tried to blend it in.

name: cjehtland
review: Second time to purchase - this will be one of my go to's

name: Chloe
review: I wanted to cover my acne spots with this concealer, but it's not creamy at all. It is pretty dry so it looks cakey with foundation. Not worth the 11 dollars.

name: Gess
review: Ii use this product under my eyes, than went over it with contour palate from Anastasia.

name: Michelle
review: This is so soft and creamy, goes on smoothly and stays on. Really evens out skin tone...

name: b1293
review: I would rate this product a 5, but it made my under eyes very glittery & it also would settle into my creases :/ other than that it is a pretty good concealer

name: KatHoop
review: I purchased 001 as I am a very fair skinned redhead.  The color matched well but coverage was minimal and the product was very creamy.  It did settle into creases a bit (I'm over 50).  Unless you have dry skin, it will probably be too creamy (not oily) for you.

name: RGS
review: A thing about this product is that it's so easy to use.

name: Debbie
review: I use this product for multiple purposes. Concealers vary hugely and there are not so many options.

name: n/a
review: great product

name: Taiz
review: Gives nice coverage and fits my face well without looking fake or patchy.

name: Mitmit7
review: Blends well, easy to use,  natural looking.  Just needs several applications a day.

name: Eve
review: Love your products the only place I buy make up at and yes I recommend my daughters and friends

name: Abbey Daily
review: I apply this concealer before applying foundation. I just dot it on blemishes and easily draw lines to blend under my eyes. It blends very well, I just wish it stayed in place better. That said, it's solid coverage and very natural looking. I'd definitely recommend it as a drugstore concealer.

name: Teach
review: This made my eye area look flaky. I'm trying it with moisturizer over as a last ditch effort before returning it.

name: Charlenebrian9
review: I use it daily with my regular make up regimen

name: COUNT
review:
Blends beautifully under foundation. Hinds imperfections,sun spots, freckles etc.
Natural looking and blends to complexion with never being heavy.

name: Hannah
review: I use this as a base for my eyeshadow everyday. I just put it all over blend it in and then set it with some airspun and it works amazinggggg. No creases through out the day and I have super oily eyelids. Such a great duo these two!!

name: Nina
review: I use it for contouring and its so light that it works great. Blends well too.

name: Tab
review: I like this product for touch ups. Just don't over do it or you will look cakey.

name: maya
review:
i bought this to cover my dark spots and it didnt do anything...returned it.
maybe its for people with slight skin imperfections

name: Jane the very organized.
review: I have used Photoready since it came out. I have liked it ever since. Photoready is the best concealear. I wear it everyday. Consistently perfect, not too oily, not too dry. It blends easy, no clumps or streaks.It lasts all day. It looks natural with my skin. Problem is: stores run out of it everytime i need a new one. Thankfully Ulta had a good selection at a competitive price.

name: BB
review: It doesn't cover dark circles or skin imperfections and it dries out the skin making it look even worse!!

name: Makeup mayhem
review: This concealer works very well and stays on well. I just wish there was a lighter color because I'm basically a snow ball.

name: Sara
review: I tried so hard to make this work but it looks flaky and horrible under the eyes, and is a cakey mess on blemishes. The worst part might be the flecks of glitter in the concealer- not cute.

name: Or nurse
review: Use rveryday for under eye. Will probably work fine for other problem areas.

name: Jayj
review: I just love it..its like you dont have nothing on. Matches perfect to skin color.

name: Debbie the teacher
review: I think this is the best under-eye coverage I've ever found.  It doesn't look too light, it blends nicely.

name: Ruthie
review: I found that there is some cream left in the bottom of the tube.  I dig it out and get few more coverage  from it.Would like to get a gift for this comment.

name: kaymichelle
review: This color is so blotchy and it fades after a few hours of wear. Would not recommend this to anyone AT ALL.

name: akHealey
review: Amazing coverage and solo easy to blend....the best bang for your buck hands down!

name: Liz P
review: I use this under my eyes, around my nose, and on other red/pigmented spots on my face. It does the job and blends well. It seems like it is a bit oily and that comes apparent around midday once it's been on a while but that may be just because of my skin type.

name: Alex
review: T zone and under eyes

name: Bobbi_ricki
review: Does not cake or crease

name: Aa
review:
Works good blend with the makeup I use could be a little less heavy
though

name: Lily
review: Very smooth and has good coverage.

name: ldt
review: Remember to blot with fingers when blending. If you rub it doesn't cover.

name: Rachel
review: This is my go-to everyday concealer. I mainly use it for under eyes but it works on blemishes as well. It offers full coverage but feels sheer. It does require a setting powder under the eyes to prevent settling in lines and creases. I like NYX banana powder.

name: Lulu
review: Great touch

name: ADragonfly
review: I just dab this on and blend out then cover with my mineral makeup.  I have used more costly products.  Really this this is every bit as good.  It covers my under eye circles without showing under my makeup.  And, stays in place!

name: Dale
review: REALLY love this concealer! Cover really well, and is NOT cakey or unnatural looking at all. The only issue is if you want to wear the concealer alone, It as a bit of glitter in it. BUT if used under foundation it doesn't show.

name: optichic
review: I have had awful skin after my son was born and this has really been the only thing that has been able to cover it all up! It blends really well, but I ran through it fairly quickly...granted I do have to use a bit more than 'normal'.

name: krid
review: This item was part of the buy one receive one half off. Thought I'd try it and I really like it.

name: Tapdancer
review:
I'm generally quite pale, so I bought the "light" shade. What a mistake! It looks bright white on my skin, and takes three layers to cover my dark circles anyway. When I swatched it at the store, it looked fine- but when I got home, to my dismay, I noticed shimmery particles.

I would have bought the next shade, but it looked much too dark. The shade selection is poor...But, I decided that it wasn't enough time for me to judge the product so quickly, so I wore it to my friend's party. I concealed a blemish or two with it, as well as my undereyes. In photos, anywhere the concealer had touched looked GHASTLY white and shiny. My pimples stood out so badly. It looked like I had put whiteout on them.

After wearing this for three days, I got clusters of little pimples around my browbone. I don't use brow pencil or foundation there, but I did use this concealer to hide veins and discoloration.

I've never been so upset with a Revlon product! For something that claims to be "photoready"-well, I disagree with that. I was shocked to see all the positive reviews! This concealer does NOT deserve them.

name: AmirsMama
review: This concealer was very easy on my wallet! which i loved, however it is a little light but it blends well and i am able to mix it with a corrector that i have and it gets the job done. i wear this product alone with just a setting powder and its amazing, covers my dark spots very well!!!

name: Vic
review: I love this! I put it on blemishes and under my eyes then use a concealer brush to blend it out, and it looks perfect!

name: Michele
review: The formula is creamy enough to glide on and the medium matches my skin tone really well.  It's easy to blend it without tugging.  This is my second time purchasing.  I've tried TONS of concealers and this one is my go to.

name: Jenny
review:
I love the look of this cover-up but, the shades are either too light or too dark. I don't use foundation so I really need it to match.
It still looks good with the right finishing powder.

name: Kate
review: I heard this concealer was comparable to a top-line brand, so I purchased it.  DEFINITELY love it, and have repurchased!It's creamy and blendable.  Covers discoloration (acne marks) very well.  I wear a foundation on top of this.  Can also be used to touch up if the spots show through throughout the day.For [$], it's amazing!

name: Alex
review: It's very easy to apply and matches my skin tone! It's compact so you can take it anywhere. I use this for blemishes, under my eyebrow, and under my eyes... it works perfectly!

name: RachLea
review: I generally use Too Faced's Absolutely Flawless concealer in Vanilla but decided to try this because it was half the price. Unfortunately, the coverage just isn't what I need/want/am accustomed to. It goes on smoothly but it just doesn't cover well. The only place I use concealer is under my eyes and this just isn't what I prefer to use. Would probably be good for someone who wants light coverage and a really creamy texture.

name: Nuni
review: The actual product itself was alright, however, the applicater mechanism locked up on it's own and then once unlocked, the concealer stick was all crooked! I was worried that it would wind up breaking off. Very disappointed! I returned it.

name: Jojo
review: The formulation is perfectly smooth - glides on like butter. The ''Light Medium'' shade is the most close to my actual skin tone that I have seen in drugstore concealers thus far. The coverage is great though certain types of discoloration may need a few re-applications. It blends amazingly. Works great as an eye primer, or for nude lips. Does NOT dry out! That's my fave thing about it! It also conceals very well. I use this under my mineral powder foundations without an issue. Just don't go to heavy in wrinkled or creasy areas, as with any cream based product. Try it!

name: psychoanalyst
review: I usually only splurge on eyeliner because it's for my eyes. However, I have tried hourglass and bobbi brown for concealer and this product competes very decently against them. It's also very affordable, which I love. But the shade of this concealer doesn't blend that well with the exact color of my skin. It does its job hiding my bags though.

name: 40Femme
review:
These tons of concealers out there & most make us crazy because we feel like we wasted money on them... not this one though. it works like some of my higher-end concealers but makes me feel better about my wallet after purchasing it.

I do not use it alone on my under-eye area, this for me works better as a heavy-duty concealer for difficult to cover areas. Works rather well around the nose, and on some large pore/acne scar areas. It also works so well as an eye-shadow base. Thats one of my primary purposes & it kills at it! (scar on brow bone- completely covers)

{Again: It may be too 'draggy'on sensitive undereyes... but that's not why I buy this one.} This is truly for those hard to hide places/flaws--> for HEAVY-DUTY covering it is the BEST! Does not look cakey and can be layered to get the desired coverage needed.

name: BEGEE
review: Price is right

name: Carol in Texas
review: The tube has a one-at-a-time click to move product up out of tube, so you don't have to worry about it moving up too far.  The distinct shape of the tube of product is perfect for easy application.  This is the best new product in a long time!

name: Chells
review:
Pros: Love the creamy consistency.
Good coverage.

Cons: Settles into fine lines.
Creases with in a few hours.

name: sb
review: too thick for under eye area

name: LaLaBarrios
review:
I have oily, tan, acne-prone skin and this product worked well!

I have discoloration and spots on my face and jawline from acne and this product did a good job covering it up! Not completely but it was medium to heavy coverage. I use this on my cheeks, under my eyes, a little on my chin, and a little on my forehead.

Under my eyes I noticed it got flakey and would settle in the creases because my under eye area was dry so make sure your skin is moisturized and healthy! I got my first ever eye cream because I never noticed my under eye area was dry until I used this product!

This product would feel heavy but maybe that's just me because I usually only wear poweder. I only use concealer if I feel like looking extra special. This product would work best on normal to oily skin rather than dry skin. If you have dry skin I would suggest exfoliating before using this product or using moisturizer.

The appllication was very easy but when you keep rubbing the stick of concealer on your face bacteria can breed on the product and cause acne. The concealer is very creamy though, and easy to blend. :)

I only gave it four stars because it felt heavy on my skin, got cakey when I got oily, and it got flaky and settled in my creases under my eyes.

name: Leslie
review: This concealer is better used as a touch up stick for me. I am medium olive complexion and have dark circles. I use this underneath my regular concealer for extra coverage.

name: Jamie
review: It was okay it just i have bad skin and it did not work for bumpy pimply skin.

name: abmnik
review:
I like this concealer, I've been using it for about a year now. Unfortunately, i'm between two colours but that's not too great a deal.
Be warned, this concealer can look cakey if not aplied carefully. It's not very buildable but it gives enough coverage in one layer that it doesn't matter. I don't use it under the eyes because it can crease a little, and anyhow I prefer something very light for under the eyes. I primarly use this concealer for hyperpgimentation. It works very well (I use a fluffly blending brush/crease brush).

name: lilu
review:
Do not attempt to cover under eye circles with it. It simply does not work for that. The concealer settles into lines and creases.
But it does cover blemishes ok.

name: Ginger27
review: Shades run darker than I expected. Use it as a great coverup and match to your foundation. Primarily use it for discoloration scars and blemishes.

name: Sugarcayna
review:
I put this on before and after I use my foundation. It actually lasts pretty good thru the whole day, as long as you're not touching your face alot of course. I wish I would have bought this years ago!
It's important to get the right skin tone color. I got the wrong one by mistake and Ulta let me exchange it, thanks Ulta!!

name: Meg
review: I bought this concealer when I brought a relvon foundation so that the colors would match, but I have always hated it! It was way over price considering it doesn't cover up anything. I put it one in the morning and it is fine, but within an hour my problem areas are back!

name: Jenny
review:
For starters, it has sturdier packaging compared to most drugstore brand concealers. As far as the actual concealer goes, it's high pigment, covers well, has a nice creamy texture, and stays on extremely well for a drugstore brand (especially when paired with a primer or powder foundation).

The only negative thing? Compared to less-rich concealers it may slightly settle in creases or dry skin.

name: JamieW
review: I love the idea of a concealer in stick form so it is easier to apply.  However, this product was so disappointing.  It goes on thick, but doesn't very well at all.  i used it for dark under eye circles and was so displeased.  Ir settled into my creases and looked dry and cakey (even when applied very thinly).  It also was a terrible color for my skin tone.  Revlon face products seem to be very yellow based and as the shades get darker, they just get more orange. It looked very unnatural on my pink-toned skin.  I thought this was a very poor product for the price.

name: Beauty & Makeup
review: I really like this concealer. I usually use it after putting my foundation on to cover blemishes or dark spots that are still showing, it covers really well. It blends well and it doesn't wear off. I had previously purchased a similar but high end product and I can say that this Photo Ready Concealer does the same job at a much lower price.

name: AKteal
review: This was recommended by DulceCandy87 on Youtube. I love it! Works perfectly for under-eye circles and t-zone. Goes on super smooth and is easy to blend!

name: Prisp
review: I love this concealer. Its very affordable and the coverage is great. I have a lot of blemishes and this product covers them all! The only con I have with this is that it doesn't last very long, but its easy to carry everywhere so its not problem at all!

name: Glam Ellie
review: Goes on so smoothly it feels wonderful on the delicate under eye area.

name: Joan
review: Quick & Easy !!

name: Sabrina
review: Finally a concealer that blends it to my skin. I have very fair skin and no matter how light it seems I go on concealer, they always seem to show up orange on my skin. This one actually blends in and looks natural. I wish the staying power was a little better but it's not bad (I'm just really picky) and since I can actually use it it's a definite win for me.

name: Jo Loves Ulta
review: Always looking for a good concealer to cover my dark circles. This is very light but works.

name: DLH27
review: Affordable

name: Linnzi
review: Love this for mostly under my eyes!

name: al natural
review: I like the packaging like lipstick.  Makes it easy to take with you.  Applies quickly and easily.

name: Calayna
review: I love that it doesn't irritate my skin AND it actually hides my blemishes when I apply it. LOOVE IT.

name: Bandit
review: Covered very well I thought.  Did not find it too greasy nor too light of coverage.   Easy to blend as well.

name: minxie114
review: Love this product, I had been using Benefits erase paste which i like but i found it settled into some fine lines...This does not!  Goes on so easy great packaging and much cheaper!

name: Mary R
review: I use it for the circles that seem to be there everyday no matter how much sleep I get.

name: sandy
review: i always wanted to try this product out, and i heard so many good reviews about the foundation one. i went to go pick up the concealer about 2 weeks ago and when  i first tried it on, i was so amazed with the silky so texture. it hid my dark circles and it blends well! i'm going to stock up on these!

name: VegasChick88
review: Smooth application, build-able coverage, true to color. Its great for the price. I usually rotate between this and my Clinique and Benefit. Doesn't have as strong of coverage and the higher brands but is worth the extra over other brands I've tried like Cover Girl and Mabelline.

name: MK
review: I use the product to cover dark circles.  I believe the lipstick like application works very well.

name: Princess731
review:
I have been searching for a great drugstore concealer that would hide my acne scars and never had luck, until now!
This concealer is great for hiding post-acne marks and scarring, or any discoloration in your skin.
I love the applicator and how it is packaged like a lipstick.
Blends well.
I will definitely buy it again!

name: Sarah
review: I really liked this concealer for under my eyes. It did not keep my acne scars covered, but over all was good coverage. It didn't dry out my skin or make it greasy. The only other thing I could complain about was that it creased a bit and I had to rub that out after about 15 minutes, and then I was good to go!

name: cat0711
review: I was disappointed in this product.  The coverage is not great and it doesn't seem to cover much.

name: no nickname
review: Hard to get the color right, but for the price, it's a pretty good product. Goes on easily...good texture. Looks a little cakey, but not any worse than the higher priced ones.  I don't use under my eyes...just on little red spots. around my nose (Broken capillaries)  and a random tiny dark scar. I like the small tube.  Good for travel and I don't need a brush to apply.

name: Mama Randi
review: Don't like most concealers. This one works quite well!!

name: Maria
review: Great!

name: RevlonFan
review: I picked up this product at random and was pleasantly surprised!!  Great product---especially compared to high end brands at a much higher price.  Will purchase again!

name: Perma-tired eyed grad student
review: This stick makes it look like I got 8 hrs of sleep when I absolutely didn't. I loveee this, and such a good value!

name: jess
review: very good product

name: Stephanie
review: Very pleasantly surprised considering the low price. Works nicely on my understanding bags

name: Rikk1C
review: This is my third tube.  Does that tell you something?

name: Aya
review: I have tried several high dollar concealers and I keep going back to this one. It's perfect!

name: Slim
review: Tried this concealer but had to return it.  It settled in my fine lines and the coverage was just...meh!  Not a keeper.

name: csl
review: It works great and has wonderful coverage.

name: Angelina
review: I would definitely buy this again. I put it under my eyes and for blemishes, and it blends in very well!! I can say that it doesn't cover as much as i would like it to since i have dark circles under my eyes but for my blemishes its perfect. I carry this little guy everywhere!

name: Liz
review: I like it ok... it works great under my eyes... but I feel like I have to use quite a few coats to cover a blemish... and it still does not cover as well as my old concealer.

name: missTish
review:
I use this as a primer to a mineral powder and the combo Very good.
I keep one at home for daily routine and carry one with me for touch up after work for night out..Oh and one in my weekend bag as don't like to be without!
Better to purchase when buy one, get one 1/2 off!

name: debdowah
review: on rosacia

name: Megan
review: I got this to use to cover dark circles under my eyes and other small problem areas!  It definitely has great coverage!  I've worn this alone for a quick fix and under foundation - both great results!

name: Jaded6914
review: I tried this on a whim after seeing a few gurus use it on youtube, it is now my go-to concealer! I use this over my more expensive ones every time I do my makeup. It does kinda settle into the fine lines around my eyes as the day goes on, but all concealers do that. Nothing a q-tip won't fix!

name: rebecca
review: Wonderful concealer!  I have tried many and found this to be my favorite thus far.  It only settles into creases if you apply too heavily.  Best blended with a brush, but very easy to apply.  Covers well and looks natural!

name: Ingrid
review: I don't know if it just doesn't work for me but, it doesn't cover very well and after a couple of hours it looks like it fades away and is spotty.

name: chaulovesmakeup
review: I was very excited to use this product because of all the hype and reviews. I have very oily skin and redness around my nose area. Within a couple of hours, the product was gone. So far I have found a good concealer, brand or drug store, for my oily skin.

name: BeautyObessedAllie
review: I wear this EVERY DAY. Its really good but sometimes you need to reapply. but its an overall great product.

name: Grandmother of 3
review: I use this everyday, it goes on very smoothly and covers everything I want to hide. You could wear it alone or under makeup

name: Nicole
review: I wish the fair shade (001) was in stock more often because it's the only one truly light enough for me, but this is the perfect concealer for pimples, acne scars, etc. Worn over foundation, it lasts all day.

name: KaitMill
review: glides on very smooth, I love the application!  I'm eager to try more photo ready products.

name: JennHunny
review: Awesome product! It's so quick and easy to use, even a lazy girl like me can look polished with minimal effort. This is a repurchase and I've been pleased with this product both times! :) Sidenote: I do not have pronounced under eye circles/bags/discoloration I just like to lighten the area a bit because I wear glasses.

name: Plain Betty
review: This is a very soft and creamy concealer.  Because it's so creamy I think is works well for under the eyes.  There is less tuging with it than with other stick concealers.  When it comes to other parts of the face it does rub off easyly so it will have to be set with a powder in order to make it last all day.

name: prettyinpink
review: When I read all the reviews about this concealer I taught this would be a good product for me but it turned out to not cover nothing at all.

name: brittanylei
review: took a shot in the dark- didn't bother to read reviews and ended up loving it.

name: Lady Engineer
review: I may give gifts but I never recommend products to people.  I am concerned about the chemicals and the preservitive that may cause health problems.  So I let them chose their own products....

name: kk
review: This is a great concealer. works wonders for me. i have a scar on my chin and it covers it up perfectly

name: Ruth
review: I like it but not the best concealer for under the eyes, if you have acne scars like myself it works wonders. I just wouldn't apply it to under eye bags since it does settle into creases.

name: honestysprotege
review: I bought this to help combat dark circles under my eyes. I like the thinner tube, which makes it easier to apply in a small area. Coverage was pretty good, but I'm new to concealer so I don't have a lot of experience with other products.

name: Marisa
review: I have a bit of discoloration on my face in which I use this product for. It works great with or without using any other makeup product.

name: Donna
review: Use it around and on my lips to keep lipstick from feathering and keeps it lasting longer.

name: Venusprime
review: It's OK, but I have used others that work better.

name: Kathryn
review: This concealer is probably the worst I have ever used. It is easy to apply but that doesn't outweigh the fact that it doesn't cover anything, is hard to blend, and gives you cake face. I suggest spending your money on something better.

name: Productlover
review: I am a little amazed at the negative reviews--for me, it's an absolute must have. I have always been on a never-ending quest for finding a good uner eye concealer. Seems every time I get a fave, they discontinue it. although I'm still trying out some Upscale concelaers (Laura Mercier, BB), I still use and keep this one. Does a great job on my deep under-eye circles. I bought a few extra just in case they discontinue it.

name: TeaWhale
review:
This showed me under-eye creases I didn't know I had. I'm in my 20s.

I hate to throw out brand new makeup, but I don't see myself sticking with this. At least it inspired me to up my eye-area sunscreen game.

name: Dovely
review: creases badly

name: Babybanks
review: Covers well but tends to crease and "cake".

name: Jojo
review: Used mainly under eye. Pleased with coverage and will purchase again

name: baha21
review: I will keep this short and simple.. I got this because of all the hype it was getting. I conceals well, but i can SEE it on my face. Like, you can see that there is product on and it goes on really thick. Also, the lightest color is still pretty dark so it does absolutely no highlighting. would not really recommend :/

name: Lucia
review: I really was looking for a FULL COVERAGE and affordable concealer to cover my my face scars. This concealer does the trick, but is a bit too dry and cakey because it is a stick form. This would only work well with blemishes and spots, but it's not for undereyes and pimples. I would definitely repurchase this, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

name: lyn
review: best concealer

name: Amanda H
review: I bought this on impulse because they were out of the shade of color stay concealer I wanted but this concealer is just average. It blends well and covers well and stays with I use a good setting powder but there is nothing outstanding about it. I prefer a liquid concealer for blemishes. In a lighter shade this would be a great highlighter.

name: Char
review: I use it mainly for under my eyes (before applying makeup), but also for red marks, etc.  Works just fine.

name: Oh my mia
review: Good value

name: Chelly
review: I LOVE this concealer! I've been using it for months now and I use it every day! It's great for under eyes (which is the only place I use it) and it hides my dark circles so well while brightening my face at the same time. While it does settle in your fine lines, if you lightly dab a q-tip over your fine lines after applying, it gets rid of the excess product so no settling in your fine lines ;)

name: CeeBiz1990
review:
I'm confused about a lot of things I keep seeing about this product. Shimmer? I've been using this for a while, and I have never noticed any kind of shimmer. Mine is matte. I am very shimmer-averse, and if there was anything resembling shimmer in this product, I'd chuck it... Maybe they've changed the formula since I bought mine?

This product is creamy and blend-able. It melts into the skin when blended with the fingers and looks natural. It's full coverage and can cover up ANYTHING. I have loved this concealer for a while now.

The only reason I don't give it five stars is because it lacks staying power. It lasts longer with primer and a setting powder, but touch ups may be in order by, say, 3 or 4 PM. But I don't really mind, because it still looks good after touching up, and the stick packaging makes touch ups easy.

This is a wonderful concealer for blemishes, redness, spots, etc. It may settle into lines around the eyes, however, so I wouldn't use it for the undereye area.

name: Cynthia S.
review: I decided to pick out a random concealer just because I needed one. Tried this product, honestly don't love it and I wouldn't really suggest it to anyone. I mainly use it for under my eyes, and it settles in the creases. So after blending all my makeup I take a peak at under my eyes and there's some of the makeup just chillin' there. So I have to take my finger and blend it again, knowing in the back of my head that that is going to keep happening. Also it doesn't even match my skin tone well. Overall, I mean..it covers well. But it loves creasing. :/

name: JennieBennie
review:
This concealer is so good at coverage and leaves my skin looking so flawIess that want to use it as a foundation all over my face! I do not use concealer under my eyes as I don't have dark circles. However I need concealer to cover up a bunch of redness on my face and my nose. My skin flares very very red lately. All the green stuff does no good either. So I use this over my foundation on my cheeks and nose and wherever I see redness/rosacea. It covers so much better than my foundation and the finish is better too. Hides/blurs my pores and fine lines. My skin looks flawless with this. I actually was looking into the stick foundation in this line hoping it would be the same thing in a bigger tube that I can just use as foundation. It got mixed reviews though so I am not sure about it.
The only con is it does wear off mid day and I have to apply more. But it's super easy to carry with you and re- apply during the day so it's not a big deal.

name: argon_girl
review: I mainly use it as a concealer and I love it! It's blends well and gives a nice finished look. Would definitely buy again.

name: Ke
review: I have redness and dark circles. It helps with both

name: Asha
review: This didn't cover/conceal at all.

name: ultra lover
review:
Second time buying it , must have...
love love love it.

name: Carm
review: I have fair skin but use sunless tanner. The color options can be tailored to your tone. I switch from medium in the summer to light/medium in winter.

name: Lena
review: I love this it's easy and handy

name: Lolabug
review: Easy to apply.  Goes on creamy. Good coverage.

name: M
review: This is a great product with good coverage and does the job well.

name: minnow
review: This is one of the best drug store concealers I have tried,  I use it to cover blemishes and sun spots.  I wouldn't describe this as a full coverage concealer.  It is more of a medium coverage.  It is not heavy or cakey.  It looks natural and does not settle into lines.  While I think there are better concealers out there, the only ones I've found are department store brands.  For a drug store concealer I think this is a good buy.

name: Lalabeauty
review: I used it under my eyes, and within an hour it began to "congeal" on the skin. My under eyes are crepey but I'v never had anything do this.  It was more than just "getting in the wrinkles," it seemed to float away from the skin.  By the way, I'm a professional makeup artist.

name: Nina
review: It works well if you have dry skin!

name: Kelly
review:
This is a very nice concealer. It goes on very smooth and I like the way it looks. Very natural.
I have dark circles under my eyes and this is a very good product and does the job concealing those dark circles.

name: Pennie
review:
I had high hopes for this concealer. I use the Photo-Ready foundation and translucent powder, and like them both, so I decided to give the concealer a try.

First thing I noticed was that the color selection seemed 'off'. The first shade was too pink, so I opted for the next shade, light, just like I have to do with the ColorStay foundation. The light shade is much much much too yellow.

However, it went on my skin (undereye area) the perfect shade. It went on smoothly, covered well, and then it changed... After about twenty minutes I looked in the mirror and it was dry, flaky, and had turned an awful orange color.

All in all, it was a great idea, that wasn't executed very well. This has the potential to be an AWESOME product, but not without some more work.

name: makeuprose
review: Revlon is one of my favorite drug store brands, unfortunately this product was a disappointment. Accentuated fine lines and dry spots.

name: xilef
review: It is easy to apply and the color matches great to my skin but the coverage it not as great as I was expecting.  The powder is wonderful and I would have like the concealer to be the same.

name: Amy
review: I prefer to use this under my eyes rather that on my face.  I really like this product. It doesn't get cakey, doesn't look dry.  Covers really well without creasing.  And I like that it is in a stick because it is so convenient.

name: Cassollu
review: It's easy and cOnvienient to use, I can even touch up if I need to. I will buy it again, better than the maybelline one! Perfect amount of moisture for my winter skin!

name: Merc
review: This doesn't cover very well and is very cakey. Barely lasts through the day and doesn't match my skin tone.

name: Evelyn
review: I was just browsing around Target when I picked up this concealer. I was trying to find something to replace my UD concealer crayon and I just randomly picked this one  up and I'm glad I did because I really like this product for highlighting. It's just as good as the urban decay concealer crayon, in my opinion. It goes on nicely and it blends very well. I don't use this for anything but highlighting my face and I was honestly just looking for something that would at a little something to my face but the Naked Illuminator enhances this concealer and after I'm all done highlighting and contouring my face looks like it's glowing so I really like this product :)

name: girlyshopper
review: Good concealer for many facial "flaws"  I use Fair under my eyes to enhance them, also I use light, which is slightly darker on age spots or other facial flaws & blend with my skin to hide them. I have fair skin so I stay with the two lightist tones. I would like to try the medium on some of the redder flaws to hide them but not sure if it will be too dark. This conceler goes on smooth & blends in nicely. Very good product from Revlon.

name: Etoile
review:
Exactly what you need when you're trying to look like you don't have make up on... shimmer. Note my sarcasm. I don't know why I was under the impression that this would be even remotely good, because it's just absolutely horrendous.

I might have excused the fact that it had shimmer, had it actually been easy to apply, or did a good job concealing, but it did neither of those things.

I initially tried applying it with my finger, and it was really awkward, it caused me to tug a lot on my under eye just to spread it out evenly. I even tried with a make up sponge, and it still didn't apply as evenly as I had hoped.

Then, not only did it apply terribly, the shimmer made it obvious I had make up on, AND it settled right into my creases.

The only good thing about this would probably be the fact that it didn't wear off easily.

Bottom line, don't even waste your money on this if you're hoping for a good concealer.

name: mally
review: this product is absolutely horrible. I do not have dry skin and when I put it on my skin looked dry and flaky. and it also had glitter in it which I also did not appreciate. do not get this unless you want dry skin with glitter on it.

name: Monika Thatsit
review:
I went in buying this product with high hopes, I saw this reviewed as one of the top drugstore concealers out there… However, no matter how I apply it, it leaves my skin dry and you can clearly tell I'm wearing it. I wanted a full coverage, barely noticeable product; instead, I got a product that feels heavy on my skin, looks chalky under my eyes and somehow makes my skin look greasy on my t-zone. No matter how I try to apply it, I end up dissatisfied. I've tried using a sponge, my fingers, a concealer brush, powder, primers etc. but it just won't do.

Bottom line: It doesn't work how I try to apply it.

And I get it may work for some, but this is the first time I've discovered a product that I couldn't get to work… to me, that implies I have pretty easy to work with skin… so for this not to work means a lot.

name: Patti
review: I'm on the fence about this product.  It gives good coverage on dark spots, but dries out the skin  - especially over acne (which is the main reason I need it).  So I'm using it for discoloration, but am still hunting for the perfect acne concealer.

name: makeupjunkie
review: This concealer is really good if you apply it correctly.. at first I used my fingers to blend it out under my eyes and I didnt like how it looked, but when I used a brush (real technique multipurpose) brush it blendedand covered really well.. sometimes I wear it alone under my eyes and I think it looks great but maybe I need to choose a shade darker next time :)

name: rugby80
review: I have never used a concealer that covers so well and last all day until now! Love it!

name: dmoushie
review: This concealer works pretty good.  The only downfall is if I use it under the eye area if I don't blend it really good, it clumps just a little bit.  But it works great, better than others I've used.

name: J
review: I think this product may work well for some but I have really dry skin.  So to this point everything I try seems to make the skin under my eyes look dry and flaky.  It helps for a little while but once it settles it doesn't look great.  My skin is fairly dry so using a powder to set it just makes me look older.

name: Iluvpinups
review: Gave this  concealer a shot a year ago in 004 medium and it was the worst concealer and coverage .  Most drug stores will not carry a variety of colors. Ulta carries deep and medium deep in photo ready concealers. I tried out medium deep which is a little orange and yellowish but applied on amazing and blended well with my Mac  foundation and BB cream by L'Oreal . Just make sure to sit it with a translucent powder lightly.  Medium deep is 005 which I am not that dark so not sure why medium 004 didn't work for me . My suggestion is make sure you by the right color if one is too light or the coverage isn't great try one shade up even if it looks a little dark.

name: nat
review:
i cannot fully review this product because i have only tried it on my under eyes
it didnt give me the result i was looking for
it is a very thick product, and tends to cake into the creases of your eyes! but the stick that it comes in is very easy to apply :)

name: LiLi
review:
Best concealer I have found - and I have tried MANY!
I have fair skin, w/blusish dark circles, this works great!

name: makeup freak 2 geek
review: For a good alternative this concealer is pretty good...the price for this product is fair so if you are on a budget...this concealer is A-game.

name: Glam girl
review: Got this in replace of boing by benefit since I was on a budget due to Xmas shopping great product nice full coverage love it

name: Revlon Junkie
review: Apply only alittle bit at a time. It you think it looks dry underneath your eyes then but vaseline under your eyes the night before, it helps mosturize the area and will make it go on smoother

name: Jenny the Bull
review: I use it as an under eye concealer and it works well. It doesn't last a long time though.

name: Tiff
review: I use this to cover up my acne spots and it works the bst of everything i used, but not as well as i wish it did.

name: I don't have one
review: It really covers great.

name: alicia
review: i use this to cover blemishes, it goes on smoothly and matches my complexion well.   it is superior compared to other budget concealer sticks, i found others to be too pore clogging or greasy.  this sits lightly on my face for all day use and doesn't aggravate my skin.  i would recommend this over other products.

name: niki5555
review: This product is amazing for drugstore! Its really creamy for a concealer stick! Even though its creamy it doesnt really hydrate! But it still works great and i just love it!

name: MamaRay
review: I bought this to cover the dark circles under my eyes, but it also works as a great concealer for any blemish. It is so easy to apply and it really does glide on perfectly.

name: Alexandra
review: My skin is dry with very few blemishes. I have slight discoloration under my eyes. This product only emphasized my blemishes and dried out my skin. The color was off even though I picked the color closest to my skintone. It's unfortunate because I've been looking for a good concealer for a while.

name: Nicole
review: Its incredibly smooth and easy to blend for a drugstore concealer. Only problem is it doesn't last long. Other than that, it's awesome

name: Makeup lover
review: It goes on quite smooth and hides blemishes and under eye circles. If you're out on a hot smmer day though it tends to run and get slightly clumpy on your face.

name: Lindzi
review: Why is it photo ready, explain

name: Makeup Fan
review: Very easy to apply but product is too creamy & oily.  Doesn't conceal well.

name: Dimples
review: I recently watched one of Kandee Johnson's video tutorials on wedding makeup where she recommended this concealer. I immediately went out and bought this. I have 2-3 other expensive concealers, but this works better than all of them. The other concealers tend to be a little too white for me, and Revlon's shade is perfect. Great for under the eyes and on the lids, or to cover any little color spots and blemishes!

name: BarbieAnn
review: This concealer goes on smoothly and stays in place all day.

name: JWall
review: I like that the product blends very well.  The problem is that is doesn't cover that great.  I have been using it for my daily concealer on areas where I need a mild coverage (around my eyes, some dark spots, etc.). Gives a natural looks, but not full coverage.

name: 60's chic
review: Very impressed with this product, stays on & has multiple uses, i.e., blemishes, discoloration, etc.

name: Sue
review: I have tried every brand of concealer.  I never like how it looks after I apply my foundation.  IT settles into the area and looks totally like I am covering up something.  I will keep trying more.....  I use Revlon make up for years so I had hoped maybe this was improved upon.  It didn't work out for me.

name: Kat
review: covers 'racoon' under-eye circles great!

name: K-tine
review: Really good concealer for the price wow. Works as well as the expensive concealers

name: Lori
review: This is the first product I have found that I really really like and it actually conceals the dark circles under my eyes.  Thank you!!!

name: Katie
review: Covers my acne incredibly well, layers wonderfully. Unfortunately, it does tend to concentrate and settle in any scabs and creases (especially around the nose). It lasts a long time and works well on my dark circles in combination with a brightener.

name: emptynest
review: This really helps to cover acne scars.

name: Sandy
review: I use this product for under eye cover up, blemishes and red spots. Works really well and the color is perfect

name: Garden of life
review:
Things that are great: nice texture with good coverage
Thing that isn't great: makes fine line under the eyes noticeable and even adds a few more to the existing ones. I would not recommend this for under the eyes.

name: Lanolin
review: This is great drug store brand concealer. I prefer it over other concealers I have used in the past. This a great creamy concealer and it works well for contouring.

name: Allie Cat
review: Easy to apply.  I love that it comes in a tube.  Great coverage.  A concealer I keep buying over and over again.

name: Alex
review:
I recently bought this last time I was in Ulta because the product caught my eye. I had never tried it before and I love Revlon products.
I use this under my eye, on my eyelid, around my nose, and on any pimples or breakouts.
I get really red on my eyelids and around my nose and usually have pretty bad dark circles.
I use my real techniques beauty blender the blend this into my face and it works amazing!
Will re-purchase and I would so recommend trying it!

name: hello kitty
review:
This isn't the best out there. I suffer from hyperpigentation and minor cystic acne on the sides of my face. This concealer works well to cover up any discolouration, but it blends very poorly into acne eurupted skin. My skin is combination, so this product just ends up amplifying the dryness in my face.

I do not reccomend this for under eye, it creases.

Best uses: cover up redness and mild discolouration.

name: JtheDogLover
review: I have pale skin, so I struggle with finding a concealer match. Shade 001 in this stick concealer matches my skin perfectly. It took me a long time to really understand this concealer because it is difficult to blend and makes creases obvious- if you tap with your finger the concealer just disappears or ends up being cakey and obvious. Now I use my beauty blender and blend around the outside of the blemish so it looks decent. This works well over blemishes my foundation can't cover. It works alright for under eyes, but I use something else for that.

name: Ruth
review:
Such a great product!
How to apply it is do that V thing under the eye it makes the concealer give you the best coverage for your under eyes.
Bad thing is the price went up :(

name: Nanalu
review: I liked this so much, I ordered two more online today!

name: danigirl
review: originally bought just to use as a highlighter for my nose/undereye/forehead areas. it covered so well that I decided to try as concealer as it actually is for that purpose. I got a light color so I apply it before any foundation and it blends well and the cover stays as long as I don't get too oily or sweaty. it can get cake if you use too much. stick style is very convenient, I just draw right on my face then use a finger to blend.

name: barbie
review: gives medium coverage, good for acne prone skin amd oily skin, easy to use, and a great product!

name: barbie
review: gives goood coverage, easy to use, cheap, and just a great conceler!

name: Jords
review: This covers my dark circles so well! It's a life saver

name: product junkie
review: My only issue is that this product is not good for the under eye area.  It tugs at the skin and provides little coverage.

name: heathahurricane02
review: This stuff is so good for contouring and blends flawlessly! A great deal especially for the money. I've Bought 3 of them!

name: Cindy
review: Mainly used for dark circles under the eyes.  It goes on smoothly.  Needs to be reapplied later in the day.

name: @sheislean
review: I use this product as an eye concealer. Does a great job covering my dark circles as well as highlighting.

name: Angel Dovely
review: Used for dark circles. After photos I don't have a ghost face. Awesome product.

name: Twins Mom
review: I use this everyday over my powDer under my eyes as concealer/highlighter.  I love it.

name: it's just me
review: I really didn't like this, I found it to be really dry for the under eye and it has a very weird waxy smell. so due to the smell, I haven't tried using this anywhere else.

name: Fashionista91
review: I use this product as a general concealer and find that it covers most of my blemishes, red spots, and does a decent job as an under eye concealer. Stays on with setting powder and is very blendable. The application is creamy but not greasy, which is perfect for my combination skin.

name: izzy
review: I finally found a concealer that covers the dark circles under my eyes. Its goes great under and over foundation or by itself. Love it so much:)

name: Aging Well
review: Conceals well, unless I'm way too tired--then nothing works.  Easy to use, this is also a "good buy."

name: mandi
review: I've watched plenty of people use this product on their undereyes, acne, acne marks, etc and it made their face flawless so I decided to give it a go and try it on my undereyes as that's my only big problem. I do use a green primer on my undereyes from Sally's which makes a huge difference and I use Maybelline instant rewind erase dark circles which I love. I decided to put the Revlon Photo Ready concealer on top of my green concealer and underneath my Maybelline concealer and it works out wonderfully. I don't need the Maybelline concealer once I use the Revlon concealer but I put it on anyways just for extra coverage. I do recommend this product! It blends wonderfully, it gives great coverage, it doesn't dry out my skin, it looks absolutely flawless!

name: Lwin the PC
review:
I use this product typically under my eyes for the bags under eyes due to lack of sleep. It works perfectly for that use. But, for blemishes and acne spots, it does not cover as well.

Any acne spots or scars, I have to apply thickly to that area just to cover it up. But since I have a pretty good foundation, I don't really need to use as much concealer.

I love how easy it is to apply. I just put some underneath my eyes, and dab at it with my ring finger and it blends in perfectly. It stays on for the entire day.

I dislike how it does not cover redness as well. I am lucky my foundation helps a lot with that. It also feels cakey at time, but that might be due to how long I've had it and how much I apply.

Overall, I love how easy to apply and how it stays on the entire day, but I dislike how it doesn't cover redness and the cakey feeling I get from time to time.

name: mumu
review: i like this concealer the thing is that its shimmering, maybe you won't see it a first but if you check your self under natural light you will notice, so it's not good for the day time, i sometimes use it as an eye primer or even a highliner when im going out at night but not during the day, the coverage it's ok too.

name: StudentOnABudget
review:
I use this concealer all over my face and I like it well enough. It covers my undereyes well without looking cakey or drying. I have hyperpigmentation form acne and it covers them pretty well without looking unnatural. The formula is very creamy so it is a dream to blend. It's very convenient and lasts a lot longer and wears off gradually compared to my liquid concealers. I wanted to try stick concealers for summer because they supposedly last a lot better and I think that is true.

The only thing I don't like is that the product has tiny shimmery particles in it which is not noticeable in indoor lighting, but once I went outside in sunlight, wherever I applied it glittered like crazy in the sun, which makes me kind of sad because I thought I had found my holy grail concealer. I guess I could use it as a highlight or primer but it matches my skin well...

name: Bianca Love
review: This was an okay product wasnt impressed but wasnt dissapointed. It covers well but it does have a thick texture to it which tends to make you look a little cakey. There are definetly better products out there for the same price, if you ask me it is overpriced.

name: Jessica,
review: Ever since I first tried this I'm in love, and it's not overpriced.

name: Lisa
review:
Love it under eyeshadow as a primer! Makes your shadow last 3 times as long!!
Great price compared to Origins primer!
Downside, only that it could use a little sparkle!!

name: Jessalina
review: I needed a good concealer to cover up blemishes and discoloration for my graduation and this is IT!  I love it!  It has good pigmentation, blends well, goes on smoothly, is easy to apply and is just a great concealer!  However, it does not last very long which is why I gave it four stars.  If you set it with powder the staying power should be better.

name: Cindy
review: I really like this product, however, I have had difficulty finding it in the shade I use.

name: Tappanga
review: Got this as a replacement for a discontinued stick from another company, and I may like this one even better! For those areas where you need a total, pan cake like coverage, this is perfect!

name: Fun, Love & Beauty
review: A little more than I'd like to spend on a drugstore product; however, it is good. Watch for sales and coupons if you are a budgeter like myself.

name: Rosie Lee
review: I was torn between the two lightest colors (Fair and Light), and grabbed Fair.  It's a little light for my ever-so-slight summer tan, but will be perfect for the winter.  Great right now for covering stubbornly dark marks and highlighting!  Love the packaging so hard... the concealer clicks up and down (as opposed to twisting) so one feels very confident in tossing the concealer in one's purse - knowing it'll stay closed and won't make a mess.

name: aaadance
review: I bought this when it was on sale for 50% off to try it out, and I'm really glad I did! it's very easy to use, covers red spots, and blends in nicely. it's also very portable and lasts about 10-11 hours on me. i wish it would give a tad more coverage to my dark under eye circles, but it definitely improves my under eye area. it is nice and lightweight which i also like. i'm MAC NC25 and light medium is a good match for me in this concealer.

name: Grandmother of 3
review: I use this concealer every morning,under my eyes, to cover red spots on my nose. it just blends beautifully and you really can't tell it's there.

name: Melian2010
review: Looks natural and blends well. People complain about the packaging which could be unhygenic, but I don't mind and you could just use a brush...

name: Concealer Happy College Student
review: I have tried every concealer I could get my hands on. They either didn't stay, looked to cakey, or didn't hide my dark circles. Dark circles are hereditary in my family, so regardless of how much sleep I get or how much water I drink, they're always present. On top of that, as a college student, they seem to get worse as the semester goes on. This concealer did an amazing job of making my dark circles less dark. I wore it to a party wear I took pictures, and my pictures came out amazing. My eyes were bright and I looked awake, even after only 4 hours of sleep! I highly recommend.

name: Kristendoll
review: This product works great! My mom uses the concealer by Cle de Peau and I have used it from time to time and this stuff works almost as well. It really has great staying power, it's not drying, it blends great, and it's super easy to apply and blend! And instead of it being super expensive it's only around $10!

name: Momo
review:
This made me go back to concealers! Since I'm trying to stray from foundations I needed something to cover specific blemishes so I can avoid full makeup. Covers them EXTREMELY well and blends like a dream. I've tried other concealers in the past and none stand close to this. Love the coverage, the color matches perfectly, and lasts me all day.

Would totally repurchase in a heartbeat. For me, it's my new HG concealer! =(^_^)=

name: sweetenup
review: I mostly use this under my eyes. I have really dark circles under my eyes and this concealer does an amazing job of hiding them. Kanee Johnson used it in a few of her videos and I decided to give it a shot. Boy and I glad that I did. It is easy to apply and blends in well with my foundation.

name: Kimmie
review: It does a great job covering up. It does settle in fine lines though.

name: Carolina Girl Emily
review: I use the product for under eye circles, red areas on my skin, and blemishes. I love that I can use it for more than spot treating because it doesn't show up thick or pasty on my skin.

name: hello my pretty
review: I use with Revlon BB Cream.  Works together nicely for smooth look.  I usually dust with power for a finished look.  Works for me.

name: Lily
review: It's a great product, been using it for 5+ years

name: kj
review: Like this product

name: Lipstickfreak
review: I really liked it a lot. Easy to blend and used to contour I loved it

name: Piper.
review: I use this concealer everyday to cover any blemishes before I apply my foundation. This is my second time buying because I liked it so much

name: Barb
review: This seems to be a newer product replacing the older one and this one is easier to apply but it does not blend well at all. Does not match my make up and I will look for something else next time.

name: Nish beauty
review: I tried many concealers and found most of them to crease. But with this revlon concealer I didn't have that problem guys. It went on so smoothly and also lasted long.

name: SarahJane
review: Works great to cover flaws without feeing heavy. Also works good when contouring. Blends well

name: Courtney
review: Wish it lasted longer

name: Mustang4ever
review: Really like this product! Will keep buying!

name: Cal
review: The product is great if you are going for full glam night out look. It is VERY pigment but it does oxidize slightly, which doesn't bother me because I have yellow undertones. However, it is simply too heavy and pigmented to wear with a light, every day foundation.

name: Stephanie
review: Love this product and use it everyday

name: Terri
review: Have been using for years and am very happy with this product, using for under eyes and small zit coverage.

name: B726
review: Great on my under eye circles. Blends well.

name: Missy
review: I like it but thought it would cover more

name: Claire the lover of mattes
review: I don't want my concealer to sparkle. Maybe my eyeshadow, but not concealer, foundation, any of that.

name: R.
review: I use this product daily for my under eye circles. It does cover, for the most part but it smears off pretty easily and is a touch heavier than it needs to be.

name: Makeuplover82
review: Weird shade, did nothing
